versions.title: Aggregation Method
versions.definition: Identifies the type of aggregation used to combine related categories, usually within a common branch of a hierarchy, to provide information at a broader level than the level at which detailed observations are taken. (From: The OECD Glossary of Statistical Terms)
versions.notes: This vocabulary was first published by the DDI Alliance. Please see: https://ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies/all.
versions.citation: DDI Alliance. (2019). Aggregation Method (Version 1.0) [Controlled vocabulary]. CESSDA. urn:ddi:int.ddi.cv:AggregationMethod:1.0.
versions.ddiUsage:
DDI 3.2
Module name:     reusable
Element name:    AggregationMethod

DDI 2.5
Element/Attribute name: var@otherAggrMeth

Element/Attribute name: measure@otherAggrMeth

concepts.title: Sum
concepts.definition: A value obtained as a result of adding two or more numbers (items/amounts).

concepts.title: Arithmetic Mean
concepts.definition: Mathematical average of a set of values. The mean is calculated by adding up two or more values and dividing the total by their number. In social/political science, it is usually the sum of the measurements divided by the number of subjects, or cases.

concepts.title: Count
concepts.definition: Total number of units in a group of items

concepts.title: Mode
concepts.definition: The value that appears most often in a set of values

concepts.title: Median
concepts.definition: The middle value in a series of values arranged sequentially from smallest to largest.

concepts.title: Maximum
concepts.definition: The highest value attained or recorded.

concepts.title: Minimum
concepts.definition: The lowest value attained or recorded.

concepts.title: Percent
concepts.definition: The number of parts out of 100. In mathematics, a percentage is a number of ratio expressed as a fraction of 100. Percentages are used to express how large one quantity is relative to another quantity.

concepts.title: Cumulative Percent
concepts.definition: The total of a frequency and all frequencies below it in a frequency distribution; the "running total" of frequencies [the maximum value is 100%].

concepts.title: Percentile Rank
concepts.definition: The percentile rank of a item is the percentage of items in its frequency distribution which are lower [cannot reach 100%].

concepts.title: Other
concepts.definition: Use when the aggregation method is known, but not found in the list.
